definition: to eat and drink gluttonously/to pig out
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: The money he had got easily was all squandered speedily on wining and dining.
sentences.chinese: 他手里的钱，来得容易去得快，都胡吃海喝了。

sentences.english: Jessica: Oh, and now, you're just going to make a pig of yourself?
sentences.chinese: 你就准备这么跟猪似的胡吃海喝？

sentences.english: Of course it is to eat much food.
Jimmy: My hobby?Of course it is to eat much food.
sentences.chinese: 我的爱好？当然是胡吃海喝啦。

definition: to eat and drink as much as one likes/to make a pig of oneself
dishes with generous amounts of meat and fish/lavish meal
to eat and drink/food and drink
to gobble up/to gorge oneself on (food)
to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
a pack of rogues (idiom); a gang of scoundrels
lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well
